strings.Value: "How much will this idea cost me?"
"I commend your enthusiasm! Why would you?"
"Then we need only to agree on the place."
"Who are you?"
"Why would Ekun want to feast in the woods?"
"Can you think of a suitable place?"
"Who'll serve at the feast?"
"What do you say, Elina?"
{n}As you approach, the red-headed innkeeper curtsies awkwardly.{/n} "Your Grace!"
"You must have come to talk about the {d|Ekun Feast Ok}feast{/d} for Ekundayo. I'd be happy to! I'll provide food and drinks — everything will be first class!"
"Don't mention it, Your Grace! It's such an honor for me... Everything is on the house."

"Forgive me, but if we are thinking about the same Ekundayo, he will likely feel uncomfortable indoors. The feast must definitely be held in the woods — if madam innkeeper is up for such a challenge."
"Hmm... How about the royal hunting grounds? I've seen the place in passing. It's not far from the city, it's a cozy nook, and there's water nearby."

{n}The woman stands tall with a calm smile.{/n} "My name's Ntavi. I'm passing through the city. Ekun and I know each other from long ago — since back when he guarded caravans. We traveled together for a long time."
"With your permission, Your Grace... for such an honor... with such esteemed guests... I'd like to do it myself, Your Grace!" {n}Elina smiles awkwardly, turning an even brighter red.{/n}
"Oh, Your Grace! Isn't it so! It'd be my pleasure! I hope everyone likes it... including Ekundayo..."
{n}Pursing her lips, the innkeeper studies Ntavi carefully.{/n}
{n}Elina is speechless, either due to astonishment, indignation — or both.{/n}
"Wonderful! In that case, I'll gladly meet both of you in the agreed upon place!"
"I guess there's no two ways about it, we'll have to have it right in this room! We can decorate it, of course..."

{n}The innkeeper sizes up the woman opposite her. {/n}"I might not know Ekundayo as well as some... but I see no trouble in holding a feast in the woods. Or on a mountain or in a swamp, for that matter!"

"My! I've seen a lot since as a keeper here, but when one just invites herself like that..." {n}The innkeeper clicks her tongue.{/n} "Oh, what got into me, grumbling, it's high time to start cooking! Your Grace, please take care of bringing Ekundayo to the agreed place. Linzi and I will do the rest!"
"He is a born ranger. He always feels calmer under an open sky. I know him well."
